page.title: 02St. Peter's Church
page.content: The first church of St.Peter was built in AD 1000 but the earliest part now standing dates from 1220. It has been extended over the centuries and plans are now being made to extend further to provide extra Sunday School accomodation. It is mainly built of soft stone. There are stained glass windows, a peel of six bells a large pipe organ, some fine brasses and a choir of twelve. Three Sunday Services are held together with a weekly communion. At a family service all the 160 seats are full with a congregation ranging in age from 6 weeks to 88 years. The churchyard contains iron memorials made at Heybridge. The church is situated away from the village centre which has developed around the Colchester/Maldon Road.
